name: Lost for Words! 7 Quiz | Lyrics Mixture | 10 Questions

questions.text:
"The ______ is high but I'm holdin' on 
I'm gonna be your number one
I'm not the kind'a girl who gives up just like that, oh no!"

Which word completes this well known lyric?
questions.explanation:
tide.

	These lyrics come from "The Tide Is High" by Blondie, fronted by Deborah Harry. This catchy song bounced to the top of both the US and UK singles charts in 1980.

questions.text:
The words of John Lennon, but which one is missing?

"Woman I can hardly express
My mixed emotions at my thoughtlessness
After all I'm forever in your ______."
questions.explanation:
debt.

	Written and sung by John Lennon "Woman", released in 1981, topped the UK chart and peaked at #2 in the US.Lennon wrote this song, from the album "Double Fantasy", for his wife Yoko Ono.

questions.text:
"Young girl, get out of my mind 
My love for you is way out of line 
Better ______, girl, 
You're much too young, girl."

Which word completes this well known lyric?
questions.explanation:
run.

	Gary Puckett & The Union Gap hit the charts with these lyric to "Young Girl" in 1968. The song climbed to # 2 in the US charts and #1 in the UK. When re-issued in the UK in 1974 "Young Girl" once again charted at #6.

questions.text:
"Roxanne, you don't have to put on the ______ light 
Those days are over 
You don't have to sell your body to the night."

What colour was the light?
questions.explanation:
red.

	"Roxanne" charted in the UK for Sting, real name Gordon Sumner, and the Police in 1979. Other band members were Stewart Copeland on drums and Andy Summers on guitar, Sting sang and also played bass.

questions.text:
"She was a day tripper 
______ driver, yeah 
It took me so long to find out 
and I found out." 

On which day did she do her driving?
questions.explanation:
Sunday.

	These lyrics come from the Beatles song "Day Tripper". This John Lennon and Paul McCartney composition was a UK hit in 1965/66. The promotional film for "Day Tripper" was one of the first music videos.

questions.text:
"And when she knows what 
She wants from her time 
And when she wakes up 
And makes up her ______."

Lyrics from Billy Joel, but which word is missing?
questions.explanation:
mind.

	"Uptown Girl" was a 1983 hit for singer/songwriter Billy Joel. A UK #1 hit it peaked at #3 in the US.Billy Joel wrote this song, which featured on the album "An Innocent Man", for his wife supermodel Christine Brinkley.

questions.text:
"I want to be your ______
Why don't you call my name
Oh let me be your ______
This will be my testimony."

Which of these tools completes this lyric?
questions.explanation:
sledgehammer.

	These lyrics come from Peter Gabriel's 1986 hit "Sledgehammer". The song hit #1 in the US, peaking at #4 in the UK. The "Sledgehammer" single was lifted from Gabriel's album "So".

questions.text:
"My, my at Waterloo ______ did surrender 
Oh yeah, and I have met my destiny in quite a similar way 
The history book on the shelf 
Is always repeating itself."

So, who surrendered at Waterloo?
questions.explanation:
Napoleon.

	Words from ABBA's song "Waterloo". This 1974 tune peaked at #6 in the US and topped the UK charts. These Swedish song-smiths won the 1974 Eurovision Song Contest with "Waterloo". The group's name ABBA is made from the initial letter of the members first names Bjorn, Benny, Agnetha and Anni-Frid.

questions.text:
"People you meet they all seem to know you 
Even your old friends treat you like you're something new 
Johnny-come-lately, the new kid in town 
Everybody ______ you, so don't let them down." 

Complete this song lyric from the Eagles.
questions.explanation:
loves.

	This classic Eagles track was a UK hit in 1977. "New Kid In Town" was a US #1, peaking at #20 in the UK. The Eagles started life in 1971 as Linda Ronstadt's backing group.

questions.text:
"What you want 
Baby, I got 
What you need 
Do you know I got it? 
All I'm askin' 
Is for a little ______ when you come home."

What is the singer asking for in this song?
questions.explanation:
respect.

	"Respect" was Aretha Franklin's first UK hit single in 1967. This track from the "Queen of Soul" was a US #1, making #10 in the UK charts.
